subject: Politics
title: What Is Socialism
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on What Is Socialism.

hook.text: Socialism says the economy should serve everyone, not just those who own capital. Share the wealth.

buildup.text: Socialism advocates collective ownership of production and distribution of resources based on need.

discovery.text: Karl Marx argued that capitalism exploits workers. The solution: workers should own the means of production.

twist.text: Socialism has many forms. Scandinavian social democracy and Soviet communism are vastly different systems.

climax.text: Critics say socialism kills incentive. Supporters say capitalism concentrates wealth in too few hands.

punchline.text: Socialism asks: who owns the factory? The answer reshapes everything.

quiz.question: What did Karl Marx argue about capitalism?
options: It exploits workers, who should own the means of production
